_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Buffalo Lake Energy Facility Prevention Program and Executive Summary

BLE has completed this RMP utilizing EPA tools available as well as external consultation for completion of the Process Hazard Analysis and Process Safety Management tools. Aqueous Ammonia (23%) is one chemical that will be utilized onsite which falls under the RMP applicability in a threshold quantity. Due to the 23% percentage as well as the NA code of 325193 Ethyl Alcohol Manufacturing code, the 23% aqueous ammonia falls into program level 3. Also the fuel grade ethanol is listed due to the amounts of pentane and isopentane present in the denaturant used in the product. In order to eliminate and control hazards, quality system procedures have been developed to provide instruction on the receiving, offloading, and use of 23% aqueous ammonia. As well as start up, shut down, and emergency procedures for the operation of the plant. The maintenance records of the tank, valves, and indicators for the ammonia system will be stored in the electronic maintenance system, MapCon. The quality system will utilize a committee, audits, and tracking to ensure procedures are adequate and implemented in a scheduled manner. The RMP program will be updated and completed by the Technical Manager and tracked using the compliance calendar. Training is defined, implemented, and tracked to ensure employees are aware and capable to deal with hazards in the workplace. Any future incidents, process changes, and items to address from compliance audits will be logged in the issues database for all to learn from. BLE is committed to the safety of the employees and the general public which would be affected in the event of an incident involving 23% aqueous ammonia. In order to avoid pentane and isopentane releases, loading of Fuel Ethanol procedures have been developed as well as an offloading of denaturant procedure . Operational rounds are frequent and would detect any issue with the ethanol storage tanks.

Safety Information
MSDS for 20-30% Ammonia    On file MSDS for denaturant added to Final Ethanol Product on file
Maximum Intended Inventory    Ammonia=90% of 74,400Gallon tank=503,000 lbs for ammonia. IsoPentane=30% of 5% of 1.562 Mgallons=117482 lbs. Pentane=40% of 5% of 1.562Mgallon=196849 lbs.
Temperature    Ammonia max 200F min -20F. Final Product max 200F min -30F 
Nominal Ammonia=95F. Final Product=95F
Pressure    Ammonia=0.25psi g@3.5" of H2O vac. Final Product=14.2 psia
Flow Rate    Offloading:    GPM max
Safety Relief Valves-Pressure    Ammonia=PV77104/PV77134. Final Product=PSV61248/PSV61238
Level Indicators    Ammonia=LI77135/LI77135. Final Product=LI 61501/LI61601

Excessive Flow Valve    None
Emergency Shutoff Valve    None
Codes and Standards    NFPA, International Building Code
Piping Design     ANSI/ASME B 31.3
Ammonia=SS1 class. Final Product=CS2
Ammonia=100 F Design Temp. Final Product=100 F
Ammonia=150 PSIG Design Pressure max 300F. Final Product=200 PSI max
Ammonia=Pre Operation Pressure test using water.Using 225PSIG for 10minutes. Final Product= Hydrotesting  
Tank Design
    API 650 CS Field Fabricated Vertical Tank for both Ammonia and Final Product
BLE has an Integrated Contigency Plan and a Facility Response Plan in place.

Hazard Review    
    
    PHA completed Oct 17, 2006
    PSM completed March 2008


Operating Procedures
Receiving Goods    BFE-MIA-100
Receiving Aqueous Ammonia    BLE-MIA-108
Slurry pH adjustment    BLE-PROD-130
Front End Start Up    BLE-PROD-102
Front End Shut Down    BLE-PROD-103
Total Power Outage    BLE-PROD-114
Issues Database    BFE-QUA-108

Training
New EE Safety Orientation    BFE-SAF-100
Ammonia Training    Power point presentation
On the Job Training/ New EE Training    BFE-ADM-100

Maintenance
LOTOTO for Ammonia valves, pump, etc.    MapCon maintenance system for each item during maintenance
Maintenance Schedule &Maintenance records for level and pressure ind

icators    MapCon maintenance system will house preventative maintenance, work order, and inspection records

Compliance Audit

BLE Compliance Calendar    Updated by Technical Manager
Quality Committee    BFE-QUA-110
Quality Audits    BFE-QUA-107
Management of Change    BFE-QUA-109

Incident Investigation
Incident Investigation Program    BFE-SAF-102
Issues Database    BFE-QUA-108
Safety Committee     BFE-SAF-103
